author: Juan Llamocuro

text: I felt like I was an actual hero after beating this game cause of this song. This song is so amazing that it made me literally cry after beating the game. Noriyuki Iwadare is such an amazing composer, and he has pretty much changed my taste of music. I’m so happy I got to play this game. It’s my favorite game of all time.
author: Derky Plays

text: nostalgia :) still play this game every now and then, both ps1 and my favorite sega cd version
author: Anonymity t

text: zophar looks so much different in the ps1 version
author: Nox Echo

text: Yeah, not so scary compare to this one.
author: Trickster

text: The ps1 zophar is scary in a more obvious and confrontational way, but CD zophar is much more ominous and unnerving. Zophar's gaze and posture are simultaneously malevonent and motherly; the device holding lucia captive, as well as the bead-like tendrils that flow through his hair look like internal organs, and his distorted ear all come together to make you feel as though something is terribly wrong.
author: Hirotrum

text: @Hirotrum Why everyone keeps saying that everything is better than the PS1 version?

author: L33TRedNinja

text: The SEGA CD version is compressed and in mono, but most of the songs feel more complete in that version.  The one song I'd say sounds bad is the original Zophar battle theme (not the true final boss theme), because the compression is really bad.
author: Lass Ellie

text:
Ahhhh...Still one of my all time favorite final boss themes. So...Awesome. Really catches the scale that the cast are just little humans who stick it to a being of near godly power.

Completely badass

text: Fighting the last boss with this theme playing was very epic, especially back in the mid 90s. I've already said it on some other video, but I like how Iwadare is one of the few composers who actually add an end to his themes, it doesn't loop.
